raw akas.title: Chicken Soup for the Soul's Hidden Heroes

akas: Chicken Soup for the Soul's Hidden Heroes USA (complete title)
akas from release info: Chicken Soup for the Soul's Hidden Heroes USA (complete title)

1.title: Going the Extra Mile
1.plot: An animal rescue team saves lives after a hurricane; a growing family with endless love; an aspiring dancer gets to the bright lights of Broadway.

2.title: Unbreakable Bonds
2.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A teacher gives the gift of a lifetime to a young girl, inspiring at-risk youth through music and dance, and a destination that teaches city kids about the wonders of nature.

3.title: Guardian Angels
3.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A Labrador retriever looks after a boy with diabetes, a unique after-school program that helps kids in Detroit hit the books, and protecting oceans by farming shrimp the city.

4.title: Community Spirit
4.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A Long Island animal shelter hosts an event to find all animals a loving home, veteran movie mentors work with inspiring young filmmakers, and an energetic mother is the fabric of her community.

5.title: Changing Perceptions
5.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A woman that uses mini-horses to encourage kids, adaptive athletes go for gold, and a teenager inventor strives to solve the world's water crisis.

6.title: Healing Ways
6.plot: An adoption house for senior dogs; a mobile medical clinic brings doctors to patients; a man spreads happiness with music and a smile.

7.title: Making a Difference
7.plot: Finding homes for sheltered dogs and cats; a young girl reinvents the wheel for greater mobility; reuniting veterans with their K-9 companion.

8.title: Digging Deep
8.plot: The mysterious salamander of the Great Lakes; a getaway destination designed for veterans and their families; a community of cooks feed their futures in New York City.

9.title: Problem Solvers
9.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A Michigan animal shelter doing its part to end pet homelessness, a man providing bicycles for kids in need, and a scientist rebuilding coral reefs in the Florida Keys.

10.title: Life Changers
10.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A teacher gives the gift of a lifetime to a young girl, a unique after-school program that helps kids in Detroit hit the books, and a man spreading happiness with music and a smile.

11.title: Group Support
11.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A unique animal sanctuary for forgotten and abandoned dogs, a micro-community helping skilled artisans to become entrepreneurs, and a professional artist inspires others with lessons of love.

1.title: Hidden Heroes Everywhere
1.plot: Inspired by Chicken Soup for the Soul's popular book series, we go undercover to find a Hidden Hero who will console our "bullied teen" when his basketball teammates won't give him a break. With hidden cameras rolling, who will help a big-city dog walker when she has to step away? Our Hidden Heroes bike patrol goes undercover to reward bikers for "going green".

2.title: Help Is on the Way
2.plot: Inspired by the Chicken Soup for the Soul best-selling book series, a talented young male ballet dancer is surprised by one of Broadway's best dancers who shares his wisdom and skill for the afternoon. Our actors play "ruthless teen girls" who bully an innocent girl and try to post embarrassing pictures of her on social media- will anyone speak up? The team goes undercover to see if a Hidden Hero will help a "climber" who freezes in the middle of a ropes course high in the sky.

2.title: What's Your Potential?
2.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A teenager who brightens the lives of kids in need one pack at a time, a young boy with play date on the other side of the world, and a social experiment that's all about first impressions.

3.title: Channeling Your Inner Hero
3.plot:
Know what this is about?

4.title: The Power of Positive Thinking
4.plot: A bullied cheerleader uses her voice to take a stand, a young entrepreneur uses his passion for fashion to send kids to summer camp, and a soup kitchen helps the homeless dine with dignity. Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet.

5.title: Kid Power
5.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A high school club raises funds to build schools in Nicaragua. A 9-year-old helps homeless women in her hometown. An inspiring summer camp for kids and adults with disabilities.

9.title: Education Nation
9.plot: A teenager's creations fund education for girls in impoverished countries. A blind man teaches others with disabilities to navigate the RTA. A man turns recycled material into houses for the homeless.

10.title: Courageous Hearts
10.plot: A girl in a wheelchair teaches others how to dance. A veterinarian who saves animals after a natural disaster. A volunteer mission to Mexico that gives the gift of a smile.

11.title: Going Above and Beyond
11.plot: A young boy with play date on the other side of the world. A 9-year-old helps homeless women in her hometown. An after-school program for boys that builds confidence.

12.title: New Paths, Bright Futures
12.plot: A supper club run by at-risk youth. An animal shelter where kids read to cats. A man who brings mobility to disabled kids.

13.title: A Bright Future
13.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. Kids with special needs learn to surf, a mentoring maestro teaching life lessons to youth through classical music, and an elementary school educating at-risk kids.

14.title: A Little Effort Goes a Long Way
14.plot: Pilots who transport rescue animals to new homes, a woman who uses ocean science to empower kids and a food pantry that caters to people with allergies.

15.title: Leading by Example
15.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A deaf football coach leads his players to victory, an animal shelter gets rewarded for its hard work and a program that helps kids improve their literacy skills.

16.title: Taking That Extra Step
16.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

17.title: Big Ideas, Big Rewards
17.plot: A woman provides aged out foster youth with new homes, Nyle DiMarco helps deaf children gain equal language access in school and a 10-year-old gives out bracelets with messages of kindness.

18.title: Neighbors Helping Neighbors
18.plot: A community rallies to get a service dog for a boy in need, siblings help the homeless earn a living selling art, and a man mentors students through basketball to become leaders.

19.title: Helping Hands
19.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A high school club raises funds to build schools in developing countries, a young entrepreneur uses his passion for fashion to send kids to summer camp, and kids with special needs learn to surf.

20.title: I Can Do It and So Can You
20.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A decorated soldier's companionship with his incredible dog, a proud dad's imagination brings joy to his children, and college students discuss the meaning of kindness.

21.title: Making Connections
21.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A woman turns her neglected neighborhood into a thriving community, a therapy dog reunites with a 9-year-old girl, and college students try to connect with others without speaking.

22.title: Moving Forward
22.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A rescue dog helps heal hearts, college students feed the homeless, and ridding our oceans of pollution.

23.title: Affecting the Lives of Others
23.plot:

24.title: Life, Love, Family
24.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A high school coach changes a player's life, physical therapy on horseback, and a woman's mission to empower at-risk youth through art.

25.title: The Many Colors of Kindness
25.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. A woman revitalizes her neglected neighborhood, a blind man teaches others to navigate the RTA, and an animal shelter where kids read to cats.

26.title: Role Models
26.plot: Hosted by Brooke Burke-Charvet. An after-school mentor program for kids at the Chicago Zoo, a boy responds to bullying with generosity, and a father and son use soccer to inspire kids in Africa.
